taxon_name.authority: Brotherus in H. G. A. Engler et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family pottiaceae;subfamily pottioideae;genus stegonia;species latifolia;variety latifolia

bio:treatment.description: Leaves muticous, costa ending before the apex.
Soil, trail banks, rock wall, tree trunk, hummocks, mouths of lemming burrows;
Greenland; Alta., B.C., Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.), N.W.T., Nunavut, Que.; Alaska, Ariz., Calif., Colo., Mont., Nev., N.Mex., Oreg., Utah, Wash., Wyo.; Europe; Asia.
bio:treatment.discussion: The bulbiform habit is particularly pronounced in var. latifolia. H. Gams (1934) discussed this taxon as a circumpolar, microtheric, steppe moss; R. Ochyra and R. I. Lewis-Smith (1996) provided a detailed map of the world distribution.
